page.title: 19CEMETERIES - DUNURE
page.content: Old Kirkbride Cemetery on former Drove road parallel to A719 has many ancient gravestones broken overturned and overgrown.The oldest legible inscription is 29 April 1779.The last villager to be interred was Sunday School Superintendent Wm Wilson in 1931.Most interesting relic is headstone carved with 2 figures one bearing shears the other an iron (tailor's trade mark).Spring transforms dereliction when masses of daffodils cover this disused burial ground.Dunure Cemetery on hillside above A719 is meticulously maintained and includes at rear 2 rows of second World War graves.Buried there are members of Royal Air Forces of Canada (6)Australia(8)New Zealand(6) and RAF(8)one unidentified.No Dunure residents were war casualties 1939/45 though many served Navy/Merchant Navy.
